1.text: Buy a patch to cover the logo up and hide it.

2.text: Lay your patch on top of the logo and line it up.

3.text: Iron your patch over the logo if it’s heat-activated.

5.text: Use a sewing machine if you have one in your home.

6.text: Get a seam ripper to cut through the embroidery.

7.text: Poke the fabric next to the logo to see if it damages the clothing.

8.text: Cut the individual stiches using the long prong of the seam ripper.

9.text: Flip the clothing inside out and pull the threads out.

10.text: Iron rubber or plastic logos and peel them off by hand.

11.text: Use 100% acetone to dissolve vinyl logos.

12.text: Remove a logo with a pair of tweezers if it’s old and peeling off.
